projects.title: Run Buddy
projects.description: Run Buddy is a website to help advertise an exersize business. It mobile-first design and elegent custom CSS to create an excellent product for customers to browse.

projects.title: Tetris
projects.description: Recreation of Tetris built using Python and Pygame. Functioning score and speed increases with level. Very fun to play.

projects.title: Password Generator
projects.description: The password generator prompts users for what they'd like to include in a password and its length. Then it generates a secure password for the user.

projects.title: Taskinator
projects.description: Taskinator is Kanban style site that uses local storage to save tasks in diffent stages of completion.

projects.title: Coding Quiz
projects.description: The coding quiz is a beautiful quiz format, that tests a users coding knowledge. The scores are store locally and can be viewed from the highscores page.

projects.title: Taskmaster Pro
projects.description: This is an iteration of the Taskmaster design that uses jQuery and bootstrap to make a beautiful, functional, and modern product.

projects.title: Git It Done
projects.description: Git it Done! This project uses Github's REST API to find and catagorize open source projects. You can then select a project to view open issues and contribute!

projects.title: Weather App
projects.description: This uses the OpenWeather API to get and display weather data in a elegent, minimal format.

projects.title: Spotify Drink Picker
projects.description: Uses your Spotify listening data to recommend you a cocktail to listen along with.

projects.title: Work Day Scheduler
projects.description: Task Scheduler for planning your day. Shows the current date hour and saves inputs from the user to local storage to save between browser sessions. Click the save icon to save a change made to that hour.

projects.title: Upcycle
projects.description: Upcyle is an application that allows users to post items they no longer want instead of throwing them away. The items are then claimed by other users for only the cost of shipping.
